column4: the latest install cd has no option "Try Ubuntu without any change to your computer" ...what boot options should I use to get the same effect?
? the "Try Ubuntu" thing is just a livecd
so they aren't all rolled into one disc any more?
what aren't rolled into one disc?
sry, was reading something :)
that's what I said, the "Try Ubuntu" is the livecd "option", if you will
NO! before that, when it first comes up, click "Try Ubuntu without installing"
but I see no such option, that's what I'm saying
what other options?
what is the second?
the second option is "check disk for defects" ...which is useless compared to the try option
ok, I'm going to boot a disc up not, just a min...
this disk is the latest ISO downloaded VIA torrent this morning
you have the alternate cd
it's designed for computers that can't support the full installer and for cli installs, and therefore toned down
if you want a GUI, download the regular cd, not alternate
same install, just without the gui
was this the download? http://releases.ubuntu.com/maverick/ubuntu-10.10-alternate-i386.iso.torrent
I don't remember actually I just clicked on whatever the first link was on the site
well, it's the first set on this page - http://www.ubuntu.com/desktop/get-ubuntu/alternative-download
I thats sms is interpreted alternate download as torrent download
* ah that's it, I must have interpreted alternate download ass torrent download
right, that's what I was thinking also :)
